work.name: Institute for Advanced Study, Princeton University
work.summary: Teaching at Palmer Physical Laboratory (now 302 Frist Campus Center). While not a professor at Princeton, I associated with the physics professors and continued to give lectures on campus.

courses: Awarded Dean's Commendation for Academic Excellence (Semester 1, 2024)
<u>Highlighted Course:</u> Machine Learning, Data Mining, Information Systems & Web Search, Concurrency

education.studyType: M.Sc. in Computer Science and Engineering
courses: <u>Highlighted Courses:</u> Distributed systems, Operations research, Formal languages & compilers, Recommender systems

education.studyType: B.Sc. in Engineering of Computing Systems
courses: <u>Highlighted Courses:</u> Software Engineering, Database, Computer Architectures & OS, Algorithms & Data structures, Linear algebra, Probability & Statistics

references.name: Professor Gianluca Demartini
references.reference: Throughout my academic journey, Professor Gianluca Demartini has been a pivotal figure, introducing me to the realm of research and igniting my passion for it. His mentorship has been the guiding light in my exploration of this field, making him a central influence in my academic pursuits. Professor Demartini is now my PhD supervisor.

references.name: Dr Kevin Roitero
references.reference: Dr. Kevin Roitero is my PhD co supervisor.
